meanings.definition: Having the same form or structure
meanings.sent1: The two puzzles are homeomorphic because they both have the same number of pieces.
meanings.sent2: The two snowflakes were homeomorphic, with identical patterns of ice crystals.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the homeomorphic shapes of the clouds, resembling fluffy animals.
meanings.sent4: The synchronized swimmers moved in a homeomorphic manner, creating beautiful patterns in the water.
meanings.sent5: The identical twins were so homeomorphic that even their own parents sometimes mixed them up.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a homeomorphism
meanings.sent1: The homeomorphic transformation preserved the shape of the original figure.
meanings.sent2: The homeomorphic properties of the shapes allowed for easy comparison.
meanings.sent3: The homeomorphic dance moves of the robots entertained the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes were homeomorphic, creating a seamless blend of colors.
meanings.sent5: The homeomorphic relationship between the two equations made solving them much simpler.
